_exec_summary.SummaryText:
<> Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Irish Town facility operates in compliance with all legal rules, codes, standards and practices established by industry standards and governing agencies in regards to the properties of the nature, history and setting of the site. These documents and standards are lengthy and cumbersome and therefore are not included within this executive summary. Specific portions are utilized as needed and references are given as necessary. 

Catalyst Energy, Inc. has implemented both a PPC (Preparedness, Prevention and Contingency) Plan and SPCC (Spill Prevention, Control, and Countermeasure) Plan for the site to ensure all possible incidents, accidents and/or events are addressed with a response that is safe, effective and timely to mitigate the impact of a discharge at the Irish Town facility.

Employees are trained regularly on all response and spill prevention procedures. Equipment is regularly monitored and checked to maintain integrity and prevent equipment failure. 



<> Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

The primary activities at the Irish Town is natural gas processing. The facility is equipped with multiple pressurized machinery (a.k.a. vessels) that each perform separate functions to convert the raw, produced natural gas from a well into clean, usable and sale-ready natural gas. The equipment utilizes propane and other chemicals to operate. The site does not store any hazardous or extremely hazardous substances above the reportable quantity threshold. The chemicals on site where checked against the "List of Lists: Consolidated List of Chemicals Subject to the Emergency Planning and Community Right-To-Know Act (EPCRA), Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act (CERCLA) and Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act" to determine if the chemicals were regulated as hazardous.



<> Worst-Case Release and Alternate Release Scenario(s)

The Irish Town facility stores a

small amount of condensate which has the possibility of a release from a storage tank rupture, leak or failure. The condensate stored on site is low and the substance is not likely to travel off site and will not pose a hazard to the public. In the event of a release, the facility personnel will implement the spill response procedures outlined within the PPC and SPCC plans. 

The closest end point to the Irish Town is an intermittent creek which flows to West Run during seasons that it has water. The creek is located west of the facility and the only possibility of any substance from the Irish Town reaching the intermittent creek would be a simultaneous tank failure and flood. This scenario is highly unlikely but the SPCC outlines proper boom placement and containment procedures if it were to occur.

The site processes propane. There is a possibility of a propane release if equipment failure occurs due to a puncture or leak. If a propane release occurs the gas will be released into the air until facility personnel can initiate the emergency shut-off and either divert flow lines or repair equipment. The SPCC and PPC outline proper response procedures for personnel and all personnel are trained regularly in response procedures.



<> General Accidental Release Prevention Program

The Irish Town facility operates in compliance with the Clean Water Act Regulations at 40 CFR 112, OSHA Regulations at 29 CFR 1910.38 and all state EPCRA rules and laws. Safety and environmental protection are upheld as highly important by all facility personnel and company management in every-day activities as well as during policy creation and company standards. 



<> Five-Year Accident History

The Irish Town facility does not have any spills or accidents reported within the last 5 years.



<> Emergency Response Program

The Irish Town facility has implemented a PPC Plan and SPCC Plan to prepare personnel to respond in a safe, effective, and timely manner to mitigate the impact of a dis

charge occurring at the site. The personnel have access to these plans and training occurs regularly to ensure all policies, standards, and practices are well-known and practiced before an event occurs.



<> Safety Improvements

Catalyst Energy, Inc. is always ensuring that safety is maintained at a high importance at all times at the facility. However, there is always room for improvement. The company management, facility personnel and third-party contractors regularly check, update and train on all aspects of safety. There are no planned updates at the time this executive summary was written.
